title: Wait Time Management and Customer Satisfaction in Quick-Service Environments
abstract: Study of 125,000 customer interactions reveals non-linear relationship between wait time and satisfaction. Satisfaction drops sharply after 5-minute threshold (slope change: -0.3 to -0.8 points/minute). Mobile order-ahead reduces wait by average 3.2 minutes and improves satisfaction by 18%.
key_findings: Satisfaction decline accelerates after threshold (-0.8 pts/min)
Mobile order-ahead reduces wait by 3.2 minutes (40%)
Peak hours (7-9 AM) show highest wait-satisfaction correlation
methods: Non-linear regression, queuing theory, time-motion studies
